The world would be forced to rely on bartering and trade. People would have to rely on their skills and resources to trade with each other, leading to a more sustainable and equitable society.
The economy would collapse as we know it, leading to a complete restructuring of how we value and exchange goods and services.
Governments would have to find new ways to govern and provide for their citizens, possibly leading to a shift in power dynamics.
It would lead to a shift towards a more localized and self-sufficient society, as people would have to rely more on their local communities for resources and support.
It would lead to a more creative and innovative society, as people would have to find new ways to exchange value and create goods and services in the absence of traditional currency.
